4427832/4348441/4434363.title: Séaghan na Sagart
4427832/4348441/4434363.text:
There lived in Ballyheane a man named John Mollowney. When John was a young man he was a horse stealer. In those days it was a hanging crime to steal a horse.The hangman who was named Bingham lived in Newbrook.Bingham heard of John and was going to hang him but he changed his mind and gave him the job of priest hunting.Every priest that John would kill he was to cut the head off him and to bring it to Bingham. Bingham would give him a reward of five pounds for it.Bingham would give back the head to John and John would throw it into a lake. This lake is now called Lochán na Gceann. It is near Aille, within a few hundred yards of the road going from here to Westport.
(continues on next page)

4427866/4351988/4435439.title: Seán na Sagart
4427866/4351988/4435439.text: Seán na Sagart was the name of a man who lived in Mayo a hundred years ago. In those days there was a law against the priests and anybody who would kill a priest would get five pounds. Seán na Sagart was killing a great many priests. One day there was a man going to be buried in Ballinrobe, and Seán na Sagart knew there would be a priest there, so he went to the funeral. When the priest was going home he followed him. The priest began to run across a bog where there were drains. When the priest was crossing a drain, Seán na Sagart threw a knife at him, but he missed it. The priest caught the knife, and threw it back at him, and killed him. He was buried at Ballintobbor, and some people say that a tree grew over the grave, and when it was a certain height, it grew down into the ground. Seán na Sagart's real name was John Moloney, and there was not a priest of that name in Ireland for a good while after-wards.

4427829/4348087/4455880.title: Seán na Sagart
4427829/4348087/4455880.text: Once upon a time there was a man who was cutting all the heads of all the priests.  There was one priest whom he could not catch because he was a good runner and he could jump any river wide or narrow.One day the man said that he was sick and that he wanted the priest to anoint him.  He had a sharp knife in the bed beside because he wanted to cut the head off the priest.  When the priest came into the house he saw a woman beside the fire and a child in her arms. The woman said in Irish "Be careful he has a knife in the bed with which to cut off your head."  The priest knew Irish but the man did not.  The man jumped out of the bed but he tripped on something and the knife went from him and the priest got it and cut the head of the man.Bridie RowlandGortCastlebarI got this information from my mother Bridget Rowland

4427829/4348088/4455881.title: Seán na Sagart
4427829/4348088/4455881.text: Long ago in the penal time Sean a Sagart ran after a priest to kill him and to cut off his head and send it to England so that he would get five pounds for it.  They saw a man cutting turf.  The man gave a knife to the priest, they had a bank of turf to jump and when Sean was jumping it he jumped into a bog hold.  The priest stuck the knife through his body but they did not see the blood coming.  The man told the priest to take out the knife.  Sean a Sagart was buried at béal an tabar between Largan and Tirawley.Eight years after that a tree grew up out of the It kept growing for twenty years.  Then it turned down towards the ground again.  A cupla of years ago it rotted away.

4427810/4346121/4458793.title: In Penal Times - Seán an tSagairt
4427810/4346121/4458793.text: Sean a' sagart was a noted priest - hunter.His real name was John Molloney and he lived his sister near Ballintubber a few miles from here.He used to get five pounds for every priests head from the English and he also used to kill monks and nuns. One day Seán told his sister he was dying and to go for the priest.She went to the middle - aged priest at the (Abby) Abbey and told him to go to him.The priest got ready and went first to a young priest to tell him he was going. The young priest said "I will go instead because if there is any danger I will be able to run faster than you". When Seán got his sister gone he got the knife ready and went back to bed again. When the priest entered the room Sean jumped out of the bed and made for the priest with the knife and the priest ran till he came to a river which he could not cross and he turned back on Sean. The priest caught hold of him and knocked him. There was a beggar man coming along and he told the priest to hold Sean till he would cut his head off. So he cut the head of and that was the end of Sean a' Sagairt. He was buried in Ballintobber graveyard and white thorn bush grew over his grave and it grew down to the ground again and withered.

4427943/4360034/4462789.title: The Penal Times - Seán na Sagart
4427943/4360034/4462789.text:
Seán na Sagart was a priest hunter.  He got five pounds for a priest.  Once he failed to get a priest anywhere.  He had a sister who was a great Catholic. He went to her house and said he was feeling sick and that he would give anything to her if she would get a priest to hear his confession after all the bad deeds he had done.  His sister told he she would get a priest for him if he promised her that if he got better he would never do anything bad to a priest again.  Seán na Sagart was not sick at all, he was only waiting for the priest to come until he would kill him.  So his sister sent for the priest thinking Seán  was dying.  The priest came; Seán was waiting for him
(continues on next page)

4427960/4361022/4465518.title: Seán na Sagart
4427960/4361022/4465518.text: A long time ago during the religious war the priests were not allowed to say Mass. A certain man by the name of Jack Maloney was very much against priests and he murdered every one he would catch.At that time five pounds was the price of a priest's head and Jack was getting rich very quickly.When Jack died he was laid in the coffin and the coffin was laid in the hearse. Two of Jack's best horses were yoked to the hearse but they could not move it; they yoked two others but it was all in vain. When all failed someone proposed to send for the priest who lived some distance away. The Priest arrived, took out his prayer book and began to read aloud.To the wonder and surprise of the people looking on, four enormous rats rushed from the coffin and disappeared.The hearse was then easily drawn and Jack was buried without any more trouble.Ever afterwards the people called Jack "Seán na Sagart"

4427830/4348142/4507890.title: Seán na Sagart
4427830/4348142/4507890.text: When Sean a Sagart grew too old to kill priests, he tried another plan.  One day he let on that he was dying, he told his sister to get him a priest, she said she wouldn't, because he would kill him.  He promised her that he would not.  So she began to make his bed she stole the sword from under his pillow.  So she sent a mesenger for the priest.  When he arrived, Sean jumped out of the bed, he began to search under his pillow for the sword.  When the sister saw this she shouted to the priest to run for his life.  The priest ran and Sean after him. He kept runing until he came to this drain and he tripped.  There happened to be a begger passing and he took a big stick and killed him.  He is berried in Ballintubber Abbey.  A  boltree bush grew on his grave.  It drooped down into his grave in the form of a horse shoe, that is the last of Sean na sagart.

5215809/5213932/5221619.title: Sean na Sagart
5215809/5213932/5221619.text: Sean na Sagart was a bad cruel man that was working for a man named Bingham in Castlebar. He was hated by all the people of that time. He used to go about killing priests and schoolmasters When he had them killed he used to bring their heads to Castlebar for his money.Bingham used to give him £5 for a priest's head and he'd get £3 for a schoolmaster's head.He'd take them then to a little lake outside Ballinrobe and bury them there.

5215809/5231457/5265044.title: Sean na Sagart
5215809/5231457/5265044.text: It is said that Seán na Sagart was working for Denis Brown. Denis Brown lived in Mountbrown. Sean na Sagart used to have hounds with him sometimes. Anyhow one day a priest passed by this castle and he went into it to see it. Sean na Sagart was in bed and he told the priest to come up to see him The priest did so and before the priest was outside the door Sean na Sagart had him. He put the priests head on a rock and cut it off with a spear. He used to get £5 for every head and every day he used to be on the look out of priests. That castle fell a few years ago and many people went to see it. The ruins of it are there yet.

5215809/5231458/5265045.title: Sean na Sagart
5215809/5231458/5265045.text: The people now say that Sean na Sagart used to be over at Carnacon and that he used to have very big hounds with him. He used to work over there for people and stay in their houses. He used always have a big knife with him and any priest he would see passing by he would attack him and kill him. Anyhow one day the people that he was working for found out that he had a knife with him so they began to put him out. He took no talk from them but cut their heads off. So when he had this deed done he could ramble about again and try to get a place.

5215809/5231460/5265053.title: Sean na Sagart
5215809/5231460/5265053.text:
When Sean na Sagart was in Ballintubber he had a sister living with him. One day he knew that there was a curate living near by so he went to bed and pretended he was sick. He began roaring with the pain he had and his sister thought he was fit for a priest. Then she went up to the room where he was in and asked him would she bring him the priest and he told her to do so. So she got prepared and went for the priest. It was not long until the priest came and went up to the room to annoint Sean na Sagart. 5215809/5231467/5265059.title: Sean na Sagart
5215809/5231467/5265059.text:
When Sean na Sagart was living in Ballintubber he had a little house of his own. One day he pretended he was sick and he went to bed and began roaring with a pain. The people living near him heard him so they came in to see what was wrong with him. When they went in they got him sick in bed so the went for the priest.  When the priest came he went up to the room and asked him how he was. He got no answer from Seán. 5215809/5231522/5265196.title: Death of Seán na Sagart
5215809/5231522/5265196.text:
There was once a man named Sean na Sagart. He was a very bad man but his wife was a good woman.Denis Brown was his master and Sean na Sagart was ordered by him to kill every priest and lay-man he saw. One day he pretented he was very ill and began moaning very loudly. His wife heard him and she asked him would he like her to bring the priest to him before he would die. (continues on next page)

5215809/5231536/5265211.title: Seán na Sagart
5215809/5231536/5265211.text: Long ago a priest was going to say mass in Poll na gCon. When he was going to the place he met Seán na Sagart and Sean na Sagart wanted to prevent him from saying mass. But the priest made the sign of the cross on Seán and told him to stand there till he would be coming back again. The priest went his way and Seán had to stand there until he came back again. When the priest came back he let Sean go. Then Seán ran after the priest until they came to a big river which Seán could not cross but the priest got over easily. Seán threw his dagger after the priest but it missed him and the priest threw at Sean and killed him.

5215809/5231584/5265418.title: Seán na Sagart
5215809/5231584/5265418.text:

5215809/5231586/5265426.title: Seán na Sagart
5215809/5231586/5265426.text: Sean na Sagart              25.1.38There was a funeral of a priest who was killed by Seand na Sagart. Sean knew that there would be a priest at the grave to bless it so he went to the funeral. When the priest had the grave blessed he saw Sean and started to run for his life. Sean ran after him. Out of the crowd only one man a tailor ran after Sean. The priest crossed the fence and Sean crossed the fence too. He knocked the priest on the ground and as he was holding him down the tailor crossed the fence. The priest shouted to the tailor to take the dagger out of Sean's pocket. The tailor did so and with the dagger killed Sean.I heard this from T. Cusack,John's Row, Westport

5215809/5231648/5265497.title: Seán na Sagart
5215809/5231648/5265497.text: In the Penal days the priests used not be allowed to say mass in their churches. Sometimes they used to say mass out by the rocks int he mountains and other times they used to have a secret hut built for themselves to read mass in.A very bad man who lived about the time called Séan na Sagart used to kill priests. He used to go to bed pretend he was sick and send for a priest. He used to have is sword inside him in the bed and when the priest would come he would kill him with it.He killed many priests this way but at last he was captured and killed himself near Mayo Abbey.

5215809/5231768/5265837.title: Seán na Sagart
5215809/5231768/5265837.text:
Once upon a time there lived a man name Seán na Sagart and he used to kill every priest he would get a chance of. This is how he used to manage it. He used to pretend that he was sick and tell some person to go for the priest. One day he pretended to be sick and some one was told to go for the priest. When the priest came the servant whispered to the priest in a way that Seán could not hear her. She said to the priest that he had a knife under the bed.
